channel.title: Wii U on David Amador
channel.description: Recent content in Wii U on David Amador

item.title: QoD is now available on eShop for Nintendo 3DS and Wii U
item.description: The day has finally arrived!! Quest of Dungeons is now available in EU and US for your Wii U and/or Nintendo 3DS. If you search for the name on eShop in our device it should appear. Game costs $8.99/€8.99 and allows for cross buy, so if you buy the game for Wii U you’ll get the Nintendo 3DS version for free (and vice-versa). US Links Wii U Nintendo 3DS EU Links

item.title: Quest of Dungeons coming to Wii U on September 29
item.description: Hey, I have some good news, I just got confirmation of the final release date for Quest of Dungeons on Wii U, it’s coming on September 29, both Europe and America. So we are nearly there, “hype.jpg”. Quest of Dungeons Wii U F.A.Q. -Does it have off-TV support? Yes, you can play with the GamePad only. -Does it support Wii U Pro Controller? Yes. -What does the GamePad screen shows?

item.title: QoD 3DS/Wii U port devlog 1
item.description: So how are the Nintendo ports coming along? It’s been sometime since I announced Quest of Dungeons for 3DS and Wii U, so it’s time to talk about what’s been happening in the “backstage”. I’m working on both versions at the same time, potentially for a simultaneous release. But this adds some extra challenges since both are very different and well, I’m juggling between two ports on my own.

item.title: Quest of Dungeons is coming to Nintendo 3DS and Wii U
item.description: Nintendo fans rejoice!!! It’s time to reveal what I’ve been up to lately, I’ve been very cryptic on Twitter about what I was actually doing but it was for a good cause, because Quest of Dungeons is making it’s way on to Nintendo 3DS and Wii U. Development started a couple months ago, so I still don’t have an ETA, but from now on I can be less vague to what I’m really doing.
